details.jobDescription:
We are a fast growing marijuana brand, and are expanding our sales team and warehouse capacity to help get legal medical marijuana products into dispensaries and delivery retailers.

We are one of the very few businesses in California that completely follow all State and Federal laws, running as a compliant operation under the cannabis laws in California. As retailer under the new requirements created in the Medical Marijuana Regulation and Safety Act, we are building a business to help the State uphold the new distribution model, and are excited about the incredible opportunity it presents.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Labeling and Packaging.

The candidate must be able to demonstrate the following:

  • University degree preferred; High school diploma or general education degree (GED) required.

If you are interested, please send us an email back with the following information:

  • Your first and last name
  • Your phone number and email address
  • A copy of your resume or a brief introduction of you and your work history.

We offer a great work environment, flexible schedule, a really enjoyable position, and a strong compensation plan. Thank you for your interest and we looking forward to hearing from you!

Please submit a cover letter detailing your cultivation experience and passion for cannabis.

Revolution Cannabis provides a wide range of the highest-quality medical cannabis products to patients throughout Illinois. Revolution Cannabis operates two licensed cultivation centers in central Illinois.

Revolution seeks an entry-level medical cannabis cultivator with a passion for medical cannabis to join our Delavan cultivation team. The cultivator will have cultivation, harvesting, trimming, and processing responsibilities.

Responsibilities:

  • Cultivate the highest quality medical cannabis following standard operating procedures
  • Clone, transplant, and maintain healthy plants through vegetative and flowering stages
  • Perform integrated pest management following standard operating procedure
  • Hand trim cannabis in safe, sanitary, and efficient manner
  • Dry and cure cannabis following standard operating procedures
  • Maintain a clean work space to prevent cross-contamination
  • Perform quality assurance checks during cultivation, harvest, curing, and trimming
  • Weigh and record data in accordance with standard operating procedure
  • Basic cannabis anatomy knowledge a plus
  • Adhere to biosecurity measures to prevent cross contamination
  • Perform other duties as assigned

Qualifications:

  • 21 years old minimum age requirement
  • Passion for medical cannabis
  • Great attitude and ability to follow direction
  • High School diploma or GED required
  • Must obtain pesticide operator license through Illinois Department of Agriculture
  • Ability to work some weekends and holidays
  • Ability to stand for extended periods
  • Ability to prune and trim with sheers for extended periods
  • Ability to lift up to 50 pounds and carry up to 25 pounds consistently
  • Ability to successfully pass internal and external background check including criminal history check by the State Police and FBI
  • Ability to obtain and maintain a Cultivation Registration Identification Card

Note: A qualifying applicant must successfully complete a 90 day evaluation period

Revolution Cannabis is committed to equal employment opportunity (EEO) principles and will consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran's status, citizenship status.

Job Type: Full-time

Job Location:

  • Delavan, IL

Required education:

  • High school or equivalent

Job Type: Full-time

GreenSTOP LLC.

Director of Operations/ Business Development

Location: In office & Remote

City and State: Los Angeles, California

Hours: Full Time

Degree(s): Master of Business Administration (MBA)

Valid Work Authorization: Yes. U.S. citizenship

Salary and Benefits:

  • Base Salary: $75,000
  • Signing Bonus: $5,000
  • Performance Bonus: 10%-30%
  • Stock options: varying
  • Health
  • 401 k
  • Paid vacation time
  • Vision
  • Dental
  • Life insurance

Description: GreenSTOP LLC is a revolutionary Technology and Media company in the world's fastest emerging market. GreenSTOP's patented technology will disrupt an entire industry. Our organization is looking for a passionate Director of Operations to help build our operational approach to market. GreenSTOP’s Director of Operations will directly report to the Co-CEO’s/ Founders. Our team is also working with celebrities and elite investors in our industry. The GreenSTOP Director of Operations will receive invaluable experience in business development and technology. In addition, this position will be a part of the exciting journey of venture capital. At GreenSTOP LLC we provide a culture of teamwork, entrepreneurship, leadership, research/development, vision, confidence, and strategy. Our GreenSTOP Director of Operations will get the opportunity to join an elite team that has what it takes to change the world with technology, media, and innovation.

GreenSTOP's mission is to deliver an expedited, user-friendly service for customers to purchase high quality products at economical prices. GreenSTOP will bring accountability, improved health/safety standards, solutions to government concerns, amazing customer service/experience, and a next generation approach to an industry with great opportunities for technological innovations

.

Responsibilities:

* Develop & Execute Operations Plan

* Work alongside the CEO and executive team to define company strategy and select which business opportunities to pursue.

* Engineer and implement improved operational systems company-wide to ensure continuous improvement without killing innovation.

* Implement processes, infrastructure and effective management practices to enable and sustain our continual growth and expansion.

* Set annual goals and build an organizational structure that supports our mission. Champion goal alignment across the organization.

* Identify organization's key performance indicators (KPIs), develop project plans to achieve goals, and monitor organization's performance.

* Anticipate operational needs and identify growth opportunities. Take the lead shepherding special projects and key initiatives.

* Continually refine business model using a data-driven approach to gauge impact, monitor performance metrics and create efficiencies.

* Develop tools and make sure systems are proper utilized to support product development and internal communications.

* Manage Teams & Projects

* Manage department leaders to drive excellence, results & maintain quality while minimizing risk.

* Maintain a global vision of all workflows within product development and hold ultimate responsibility for successful project management.

* Provide coaching and professional development opportunities to all team leaders.

* Manage individual performance by creating employee incentives, establishing KPIs for all individuals, and implementing performance reviews.

* Oversee P&L Performance

* Oversee all financial strategy, management, and compliance. Keep CEO and leadership team informed, with ready access to necessary reports, data and performance metrics.

* Design operating budget and manage expenses.

Experience Guidelines:

* Minimum of 5-7 years of experience in senior leadership role.

* At least 2 years of experience of successfully managing a multi-faceted technology business is a must.

* Experience developing systems and workflows to support a growing organization.

* Experience leading a team of employees with demonstrated achievement of ambitious goals.

* Demonstrated success in project management of complicated work streams to successful implementation.

* Experience in strategy development and financial management; strong critical thinking and organizational skills.

* Results-oriented, pays high attention to detail in all aspects of work.

* Excellent communication skills – both oral and written.

* Is proactive, team-oriented, comfortable with ambiguity, and able to make decisions in the face of uncertainty.

* Thrives in a fast-paced, collaborative, and entrepreneurial environment.

* Proficient with Salesforce (a major plus).

* Experience working with the Agile project management framework is preferred.

Preferred:

  • Business Plan Development (Strongly Preferred)
  • Retail Development (Strongly Preferred)
  • Venture Capital Fundraising experience (Preferred)
  • Experience in market strategy with technology (Strongly Preferred)
  • Cannabis retail /Business Experience ( Preferred)

GreenSTOP LLC. is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status

.

This is a Temporary Part- Time 1099 CONTRACT with an opportunity for full time and equity. To be considered, please send your resume and LinkedIn profile.

www.GreenSTOP.US

Experienced and Celebrated I-502 Producer/Processor seeking Paid Garden Apprentices for 6-month Duration,

(4) Garden Apprentice Positions available.

Prior to applying, please be able to “yes” to the following questions, any non-direct CV’s will be immediately dismissed:

  • Do you have an interest in indoor production of Cannabis on a commercial level?
  • Are you over 21 and have accredited academic experience in horticultural/agricultural sciences or previous agricultural work experience?
  • Are you capable of committing to a 6 month period of estimated/anticipated Monday-Thursday 1-6 pm. No call offs.
  • Can you stand on your feet for five or more hours and able to lift over 50lbs?
  • Are you comfortable with working on ladders and with heights?
  • Can you maintain a positive attitude under pressure and work in a team environment?

Please do not apply for this position if you are currently growing cannabis in any capacity .

Areas of Focus and Skill Development:

  • Stock Plant Upkeep
  • Propagation
  • Nursery
  • Flower
  • Harvest/Post Production
  • IPM
  • I-502 Compliance
  • Cultivation Techniques

Basic Responsibilities:

  • Cloning
  • Transplanting
  • Moving Plants
  • Pruning
  • Canopy Organization
  • Harvesting
  • Waste-Management/Compliance
  • Sanitation Practices

Compensation :

  • $13/Hour
  • Product Stipend
  • Introduction to Industry

Job Summary

Must have excellent customer service to all patients by providing patients with prompt service, quality products, and maintaining a clean and comfortable store environment. This position is responsible for assisting patients with products, while abiding by policies, procedures and operational guidelines. Were looking for passionate, hard-working, positive team players!

Responsibilities and Duties

  • Having integrity, honesty and knowledge of our products.
  • Maintaining a calm and patient demeanor.
  • Meet store operating policies and standards, including providing quality products, cash handling and store safety
  • Ability to provide an exceptional customer service experience to every customer/patient. * Maintain and update all online and in-store menus throughout the day
  • Processing and filing patient paperwork while completing patient profiles with all provided information.
  • Explain processes and inform customers of promotions, sales, new products, popular products and relevant products for customer needs.

Qualifications and Skills

  • 2 years of Customer Service experience
  • Own Transportation

Job Type: Part-time

The Business Operations Team Member will be responsible for supporting both the office and field sides due to the large amount of overlap in responsibility. On both sides of this role, the Business Operations Team Member will need to be aware that they must possess the ability to work well on a team as well as be self-motivated and accomplish tasks accurately and quickly in an independent manner. These individuals must be able to multi-task, work quickly and efficiently, and be adaptable to change priorities and tasks as needed. We have a very fast- paced environment as we continue to grow and expand. Must be motivated, trustworthy, and a team player.

This position is hourly, with the pay rate depending on experience. It is not a management or commission sales position.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

OFFICE

Strong Inventory Management Skills:

  • Responsible for handling state-monitored inventory tracking system in a way that reflects company standard operating procedures.
  • Responsible for processing inventory based on company and government standards to generate saleable product and fulfill orders in a timely manner.
  • Responsible for quickly and accurately updating team members through use of various software applications and technologies to ensure product is sold in a compliant manner which meets the needs of both clients and sales representatives.
  • Responsible for caring for product in a manner which reflects company standards as it relates to proper storage and transportation.

Strong Communication Skills:

  • Responsible for clearly and concisely transmitting information between team members, sales representatives, production crew and/or clients when performing functions related to all of the above inventory management responsibilities.
  • Business Ops Member must function with an awareness of how much of the information related to performing job functions is somewhat sensitive and should not be freely discussed.
  • Business Ops Member must be available to follow up on work performed during at any given time to rectify issues as they arise.
  • Business Ops Member must possess technology and skills related to said technology to achieve positive and timely communication to provide essential information.

Order Fulfillment:

  • Business Ops Member should expect to be able to pick up and push heavy objects as well as work under fast-paced and stressful conditions for fairly long periods of time.
  • Business Ops Member must take ownership of work and immediately communicate essential information to rectify mistakes.
  • Almost every aspect of the job is somewhat time sensitive and all functions require Business Ops Member to keep an awareness of what times of day serve as windows to perform essential job functions while other times of day are closed off to these opportunities - as they relate to operating hours of clients, state-mandated time windows, etc.

FIELD SIDE

Driving Skills

  • Business Ops Member is responsible for accurately recording and taking ownership of the duties performed and when delivering on company time.
  • Business Ops Member must display a sensitivity towards correlation between company reputation and employee conduct. The way we drive will reflect in the success of our ability to compliantly delivering product in a timely manner.
  • Business Ops Member is responsible for possessing the ability to drive in a safe, time sensitive and consistent manner that reflects respect for company policies and customer expectation.

Customer Service:

  • Personally responsible for substantiating activities when performing deliveries for the sake of harvesting customer feedback, market data as well as rectifying any complications related to performing essential job functions.
  • Will be responsible for presenting oneself in a clean, respectful, responsible, confident, and professional manner. Business Ops Member are delivering on behalf of account managers and this should be reflected in the way they conduct themselves when interacting with clients.
  • Must maintain an awareness of laws and regulations to support client, but must also conduct themselves and behave in a manner which demonstrates Cura’s willingness to assist the client in any way they feel they need to be.

Time Management

  • Responsible for diligently recording data related to deliveries and following planned routes very closely and in the timely manner to meet state requirements.
  • Must show consistent and adequate preparedness in resolving customer issues or conducting deliveries, especially on long routes, so that they can be performed in a compliant manner that reflects sales representative and customer needs.
  • Will be responsible for having a somewhat flexible schedule to meet the needs of long distance delivery routes or other client/rep needs.
  • Following all state, local, and company rules and ensure conformance to all law.
  • Good driving record and valid driver’s license
  • Taking instructions from supervisors

job qualifications

  • 3+ years’ outside sales experience
  • Bachelor’s degree preferred
  • Must be willing to travel
  • QuickBooks experience
  • Comfortable using computer and sales software
  • Self-motivated and comfortable working with little to no direction
  • Excellent interpersonal communication skills
  • Knowledge of the Cannabis industry preferred

compensation

Compensation depends on experience. Full time Cura employees are eligible for Medical, Dental and Vision benefits after 60 days of employment.

Job Type: Full-time

Required experience:

  • Legal & Varifiable: 1 year

Job Summary

Hi,

We're Budsy, a cannabis tech start-up based in West Hollywood offering one-touch personalized delivery. We're rapidly growing and are looking to add another member to our team.

Our ideal candidate is self-motivated, driven, professional, a people person, can work independently in a start-up environment, and of course, passionate about cannabis. The candidate must be based in LA and have a minimum of a year's experience in the cannabis industry.

Responsibilities and Duties

The role comes with the following duties:

Operations

You will match people placing orders with the best strain that fits their profile. In essence, the same task as a budtender, but done through a virtual dashboard. The candidate we're looking for has an expansive knowledge of cannabis strains and is great at providing quality customer service.

Business Development

You will reach out to dispensaries and other potential partners to establish and maintain a business relationship with Budsy. Our ideal candidate is active in the cannabis community or is looking to get their foot in the door.

Social Media

You will post and maintain our presence on our social networks. The ideal candidate has experience managing social media accounts, can independently create visual content and written copy, and has a friendly and engaging, yet professional online persona.

Job Type: Full-time

Job Location:

  • Los Angeles, CA

Required education:

  • Bachelor's

Required experience:

  • budtending/cannabis industry: 1 year
  • customer service: 2 years
  • social media: 1 year

Required license or certification:

  • Driver's License

We are an edible company based in southern California. We are looking for a passionate individual to join our crew. Your job will be of many hats but mainly all hands on labor intensive work. You will be helping with dishwashing and packing products into boxes - then maybe move up into other areas - we are a fast growing company with lots of room for growth for the right individual.

You must be the ultimate handyman and must have at least 3 years of experience doing work with your hands. You will be learning a lot from working with us, the experience is priceless.

To qualify you need

1.) A valid and current California drivers license

2.) A good driving record (no recent DUI's, etc.)

If you are interested, please send us an email back with the following information:

1.) Your first and last name

2.) Your phone number and email address

3.) A copy of your resume

4.) A link to your social media - i.e Facebook / Instagram accounts (For our protection- So we can verify who you are)

5.) Your availability

Job Summary

Seeking entry level Cultivation Technician position in Long Beach California.

Responsibilities and Duties

CULTIVATION TECHNICIAN JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Maintain plant health throughout the cultivation process.
  • Daily monitoring of irrigation
  • Maintain good agricultural practices.
  • Maintain accurate records, inventories, and data as needed.
  • Perform other tasks as required.

CULTIVATION TECHNICIAN SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITY:

  • Enforce standard operational procedures.
  • Enforce company policy and mediate disputes.
  • Ensure compliance throughout the cultivation process in conjunction with the Cultivation Specialist and Cultivation Manager.
  • Enforce the anti-diversion policy.

Qualifications and Skills

CULTIVATION SPECIALIST SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Commitment to Quality
  • Results Focus
  • Attention to Detail
  • Communication Skills
  • Safety

ADDITIONAL ELIGIBILITY QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Military Experience
  • Team Building / Development Courses

PHYSICAL DEMANDS

The employee is occasionally required to stand, walk, use hands to finger, handle or feel; and reach with hands and arms. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. Use hands and fingers to grasp, move, or assemble objects. Reacts quickly using hands, fingers, or feet. Bend, stretch, twist, or reach out. Make fast, repeated movements of arms, wrists, hands, and fingers. The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.

We are a dynamic cannabis company leading the way in a competitive and exciting industry with limitless growth. You are a driven and self-motivated individual with ambition to build a career and showcase your abilities in an environment that fosters your creativity and entire skill-set.

 Market & & Industry Knowledge:

 Daily Procedure:

Required Skills:

 Professionalism

 Motivated to learn and resourceful

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $15.00 to $18.00 /hour

Job Location:

  • Los Angeles, CA

Company Overview:

At Holistic Industries, our mission is to provide patients with the highest quality, safest cannabis medicine possible. Our medicine is designed to alleviate the symptoms of numerous medical conditions. As our name suggests, we care for the whole person, taking into consideration mental and social factors along with the physical symptoms of a disease or illness. This means our company develops and offers a wide range of proprietary strains that increase desired cannabinoids such as cannabidiol (CBD), with its low psychoactivity and lack of other side effects. These high CBD strains have become our foundation for creating safe medication for patients in need.

Founded in 2014, Holistic Industries was the first cultivation center to open in Washington D.C. and the first to bring CBD to market. Today we own and operate a total of five medical cannabis facilities in two states and the District of Columbia – and we are growing. Holistic facilities include cultivation centers, where we grow the highest quality, safest medical cannabis available; processing centers, where we develop and package medical cannabis products; and dispensaries, where we ensure our customers have the treatments they need.

We are looking to expand our team, which comprises the nation’s most knowledgeable experts in cultivation and medical dispensing, along with professionals who are top of their fields in medical professions, security, agriculture, real estate, and the legal distribution of other highly controlled substances. Our leadership includes public servants, thought leaders, investors, and representatives of one of the most established agricultural companies in Maryland.

Candidate Summary and Qualifications:

The ideal candidate will have at least 2 years experience as a greenhouse technician in a hydroponic vegetable production or bedding plant production facility. The candidate should understand basic horticulture and how production cycles work in large-scale agriculture. Ideal work experience would be with manual maintenance of high dollar vegetable crops such as tomato, cucumber or peppers. This position will work closely with and report to our Grow Lead, assisting in all aspects and stages in Production and planning. The prospective employee should have a solid work ethic that is proven through their resume. Must be a team player and should be self motivated to maintain production standards of quality, safety, and efficiency. This person should be punctual, detail oriented and able to manage their time effectively to complete multiple tasks daily. Candidate should have reliable transportation.

Position Responsibilities (include, but not limited to):

-Basic plant maintenance: defoliation, topping, pruning, trellising, cutting

-Propagation

-Assist in harvest and packaging

-Cleaning and sanitization of production areas and all equipment associated

with production

-Set-up and break down of production areas

Please note, drug testing is a requirement for employment.

To Apply For This Position , please click the following link and complete the application, as well as upload your resume:

https://holisticforms.wufoo.com/forms/z6374fo1e0drev/

Job Type: Part-time

details.jobTitle: Outside Sales Rep (full / part-time) Cannabis Marijuana Industry
details.jobDescription:
We are a fast growing marijuana brand, and are expanding our sales team to help get legal medical marijuana products into dispensaries and delivery retailers.

If you have experience in field sales and want to enter an industry with unparalleled opportunity where you can also help people, then this could be a great opportunity for you.

We are one of the very few businesses in California that completely follow all State and Federal laws, running as a compliant operation under the cannabis laws in California. As retailer under the new requirements created in the Medical Marijuana Regulation and Safety Act, we are building a business to help the State uphold the new distribution model, and are excited about the incredible opportunity it presents.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Generate sales with cannabis retailers.
  • Communicate effectively with retailer personnel regarding products, sales activities, promotions, and client / sales plan objectives.
  • Use a mobile system to accurately record details of your sales visits and orders.
  • Be dedicated to providing excellent customer service and to develop a professional working relationship with dispensary management and associates to effectively meet company objectives.

The candidate must be able to demonstrate the following:

  • Successful Sales Experience: Prior Pharma Sales Experience is a Plus.
  • University degree preferred; High school diploma or general education degree (GED) required.
  • Computer Skills: Proficient use of (and must own) a personal computer, mobile smart phone, printer and be familiar with Adobe, Word, Excel, and Google Docs/Apps.

You must have (or be willing to get):

  • A valid and current doctors recommendation to be a current MMJ patient (California law requires you to be a patient to be able to possess and transport marijuana)
  • A valid and current California driver’s license
  • Reliable transportation
  • A good driving record

If you are interested, please send us an email back with the following information:

  • Your first and last name
  • Your phone number and email address
  • A copy of your resume or a brief introduction of you and your work history.

We offer a great work environment, flexible schedule, a really enjoyable position, and a strong compensation plan. Thank you for your interest and we looking forward to hearing from you!

Kushie Team

Who We Need :

We are currently building a high-performance start-up team of independent contractors that is committed to integrity and collaboration, across the U.S., Europe, and Canada. Strong candidates will be attuned to current and future trends, and possess a passion for creativity, innovation, helping others, the future of our environment, and positive social change. We strive to achieve excellence by partnering with visionaries who are committed to bringing these exceptional brands to life, and building a business and a life to be proud of.

Responsibilities:

* Positively represent our products and our mission by championing the products and providing integrated product features and benefits in a true and compliant fashion to consumers, retail facilities, and potential team members.

* Work closely with our team and business partners to drive and support all marketing and sales initiatives.

* Ensure partnership success through the creation of strong relationship with consumers, retail customers, and business partners, using company provided tools and training.

* Knowledgeably answer questions about our company, our mission, our products and processes. * Educate consumers, retail customers, and new business partners about our products and services.

* Act as an ambassador of the brand at all times.

* Distribute marketing materials and provide product demonstrations, and educational events.

* Recruit new business partners, using the unique set of company provided marketing and business building tools

* Attend weekly webinars, conference calls and annual Conferences.

Skills and Requirements:

Must be 18+ yrs of age.

Cannabis/Hemp industry knowledge preferred, or be willing to learn.

No prior sales experience required Flexible schedule, set your own hours

No inventory requirements

Remote position - work from home using basic computer/phone/inter-personal communication skills.

We offer a competitive compensation, bonus and incentive package, and a collaborative support and training environment in an emerging market. The job description is representative of typical duties and responsibilities for the position and it is not all inclusive. This is a 100% COMMISSION BASED 1099 independent contractor position.

Job Type: Commission
